metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8877 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The gdImageScaleTwoPass function in gd_interpolation.c in the GD Graphics Library (aka libgd) before 2.2.0, as used in PHP before 5.6.12, uses inconsistent allocate and free approaches, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a crafted call, as demonstrated by a call to the PHP imagescale function.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8877` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgd-tools - 2.1.0-3ubuntu0.1
libgd3 - 2.1.0-3ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> php uses the system libgd2 tyhicks> 2.1.0-3, as shipped in Trusty, has quite a different implementation for gdImageScaleTwoPass() but I believe it is still affected

criterions.comment: libgd2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-3ubuntu0.1').
